text:
We decided to try this place based on the Yelp reviews. I have to say that it did not disappoint. We had a small chorizo pizza and a small Hawaiian pizza and mango batidos (shakes). The pizza dough was light and airy. The sauce subtle, the cheese and toppings plentiful and tasty. The shakes creamy and delicious. (If you have never tried a Cuban batido, you are truly missing out. They are not as sweet as a regular shake, but they are delicious).  

I should mention that they only sell whole pies, not pizza by the slice.

We also tried the pastelitos de guayaba (guava and cheese filled flaky pastry). Also very tasty.  Just an FYI, the menus are in Spanish, and the pastries are located in the back, you have to ask for them. Don't worry if you don't speak Spanish, the staff speaks English.

The place is tiny, but very bright inside and super clean. It is located in a small strip mall next to the Cuban used car dealer. There was no sign out front, you have to turn into the parking lot to find it. I have to admit that we did drive past it, and only found it when we used our GPS. They are across the street from Marketon if that helps.

They have only been open for three months, but while we were there, a steady stream of customers came in, a lot of them repeat customers.

We will definitely be back to try some of their other pizzas and shakes.

Incredible flavor and quality brings what Cuban taste and style is i recommend this small place to all people out there 
Food was Fantastic!!!!!
Thanks to there team for the experience!!!!

They were closed for remodeling but they are open now. We have been coming here for a long time for the coffee which is fabulous and the flan is great We recently tried the Cuban pizza (we had the cheese) and it was really good. The employees are professional and friendly . Most of them speak Spanish but some speak English and everybody will try to make sure you get what you want and will do everything to make you feel at home. We love this place and highly recommend it.
Extremely authentic Cuban bakery with a large focus on the aesthetics of there food. The taste is on point and sure to remedy anyone feeling home sick for the island.
El lugar una auténtica pasada. El mejor servicio q me llevo de la ciudad. La chica que me atendió además de majisima muy atenta. Me llevo un buen sabor
Food is great and coffee is exceptional here. Their cortadito and cafe con leche taste like the authentic ones in Miami!

Are you Cuban? En ese caso no deje de ir a Sylvain, porque es como comer en algún lugarcito de la Habana... las pizzas son como las de alla'. Y los batidos... el de guayaba estaba riquísimo.

If you are not Cuban, you probably won't have the emotional connection Cubans have with this kind of food, but still you should try it! The pizzas are great, different than what you are used to in the US. And the smoothies/shakes were to die for (for my palate).

I tried like 8 things... they were all good.

OMG best coffee ever. That's all I had. I'll definitely be back. I don't care if they don't speak good English. I moved from England 10 years ago and don't know why it is so hard to get good coffee here. The coffee here is as good as any I've had in France, Italy or Spain. I'm going to have a good day. Thanks Sylvain, see you soon. Can't wait to try your Cuban sandwich.

I didn't know Cuban pizza was a "thing" but apparently it is. And it's decently good. A touch greasier than usual, with a slightly denser dough and a buttery crust, I would almost liken it to Little Caesars style. 

Pizzas come in two sizes, indicated as CH(?) and G (grande?)- the smaller of the two is generally $6 with the larger size closer to $8.50. The small is a bargain, as it easily feeds two. Toppings available here include roasted red pepper, pepperoni, ham and pineapple, shrimp, and chorizo. The chorizo is my pick, chopped small but distributed well, salty but not too greasy. 

Service does not speak English, so go in prepared to use hand gestures as needed if you don't speak Spanish. Menu also offers Cuban coffees (cortado seems to be the favorite) and various pastries and cakes. Check the "tips" on the app, as the Yelp page hours are currently inaccurate.

My husband and I visited for lunch as part of our "Team Lara Saturday". 

Cuban Sylvain Bakery is tucked away in a strip mall on the north side of Tropicana. The parking lot is small but parking is ample. Inside are four high boy tables with stools and a small bartop, making seating for just about 12. As such, it seemed most of the orders were to go. 

Let me get this out: this is not, by any means, a fancy place. It's straightforward - menu, tables, and pizza and very fair prices. 

Like the ambiance, the menu is focused: small and large pizzas ranging from $5-$12 with mostly pork-centric toppings (chorizo, ham, or Hawaiian) and a selection of Cuban beverages, including shakes. As far as bakeries go, the pastry selection seemed limited, but they do offer cakes and a few desserts. 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cuban-sylvain-bakery-las-vegas?filter_by_userid=True&select=pibdh3ESU8EMzTIJ-DPZcQ&userid=5DFshFQlbQiQTvtzH7qwlA#RQzwp3EDKtwkBrt3tpqoEA

Now, what makes a Cuban pizza, you ask? My extensive *cough* GOOGLE *cough* research leads me to understand the following:

1. The crust is puffier.
2. The cheese used is a blend of mozzarella and gouda.
3. The toppings are baked IN to the pizza (meaning crust, sauce, toppings, AND THEN cheese)

All that said, at $13 for two small pizzas (one pepperoni and one ham), a Malta (AKA instant diabetes with 36g sugar 58g carbs), and a bottle of water, I'm satisfied. What stood out for me was the crust, which was definitely puffier, but not at all doughy. It was like a pizza crust had a baby with a loaf of Cuban bread and happiness happened for all. It was well baked and had a lovely cheesy crispiness on the edges. Clearly, from my photo, the the toppings were baked on top, but that's fine with me. We ate the pepperoni pizza on site and it was served straight out of the oven. The ham pizza was devoured upon our return home. I have to say, it was just as good a little cold as it allowed for the flavors of the sauce, crust, and jam to become more pronounced. Also, the jam was far more generously topped. The plan, next time, is to try the onion pizza as it seemed a popular selection among those who ordered after us.

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cuban-sylvain-bakery-las-vegas?filter_by_userid=True&select=pibdh3ESU8EMzTIJ-DPZcQ&userid=5DFshFQlbQiQTvtzH7qwlA#pibdh3ESU8EMzTIJ-DPZcQ

3 estrellas por que ? El lugar es acogedor, pequeño pero muy bien decorado, realmente te hace sentir en algún lugar de cuba, la comida en esta ocasión optamos por pizzas, con sabor excelente muy bien cocidas y con un estilo que hace recordar a la pizza cubana, ahora el lugar no tiene un menú impreso, al llegar y preguntar por el menú se nos dijo que teníamos que mirar la pantalla ahí miras hacia arriba y tienes que esperar que llegue al menú de pizzas y obviamente escoger rápido porque la pantalla no se detiene, así que quien tenga intenciones de pedir mucha variedad lleve lápiz y papel.... otra cosa que a mi entender le resta calidad al lugar (Es mi valoración muy personal) es que todo es servido en platos y con cubiertos desechables, que desde el punto de vista higiénico esta perfecto, pero desde el punto de vista estético y práctico le quita puntos al lugar , comer una pizza que no está picada (slice ) con un cuchillo y tenedor plástico resulta algo no confortable a los comensales...y por último el carisma de la chica que nos atendió que la verdad no fue el mejor pero esto es muy subjetivo así que en nuevas visitas al lugar veremos si es su forma habitual de tratar al público o simplemente tenía un mal día.. porque todos tenemos derecho a tener un mal Día somos seres humanos...

Delicious food tucked away in a random strip mall - if you eat in Vegas you know that's always where the best restaurants are. They now have digital screens that list menu items in ENGLISH and Spanish which is super helpful for those of us who are living that sad monolingual life! Everything is made fresh to order - the pizza is so good, the French fries are so good, and the Cuban sandwich is so good - perfect ratios of mustard and pickles and ham and pork. Good soda selection and the pastries are pretty good - it's not Porto's, but it's still pretty yum!

I've only tried Cuban pizza twice and both times were in Las Vegas. It's a shame I never ate it growing up in south Florida, but my parents usually ordered Little Caesar's. I enjoyed the pizza at Cuban Sylvain Bakery much more than the one at Roly's Bakery just down the street. 

The pizza de ají was baked to order, arriving hot and topped with pieces of roasted red pepper. I really liked the thick, buttery crust and the way the cheese was baked all the way to the edge of the pan so it became crispy. A small pie costs around $6 and feeds two average-sized appetites. A shot of Cuban coffee was rich and flavorful, with sugar served on the side to sweeten to personal preference. The only disappointment was a guava cream cheese pastry. While they do bake pastelitos in house, a sliver of cream cheese the size of a pat of butter as filling was not proportional to the size of the turnover.

The hours listed on Yelp are wrong. I think they are open every day from 10am-8pm and closed Wednesday but already submitted corrections to Yelp and then I forgot.

For being a small hole in the wall place it is definitely worth trying. Very homemade taste at a good price. Definitely try the spaghetti with the mild chorizo sauce. We'll definitely be back when in Vegas.
Food was good but the service was not good. Being a little welcoming will help this business thrive.
Best pizza in Las Vegas !!!!  Must try the chorizo and jalapeño and pepperoni !!!  Always busy , recommend to order and pick up

this place a joke asked the lady at the cash register for a glass of water said, they ran out of water. 
plus she got an awfull attitude and not friedly at all

este lugar es un juego 
le pedi un vaso de agua a la cajera y me dijo ke se les avia acabado el agua 
ademas tiene una actitud horrible y no es amistosa para nada
Love this place!  My family loves to come here. Will continue to come and purchase baked goods!

This is definitely the worst place we have ever been to. We were traveling to Vegas from New York place was disgusting and the lady who take our order doesn't make us feel welcoming was really mean Also  the woman who looked like she worked in the back back give us the most nasty look that I ever had the only people who made me feel safe that my plate was not spit were the guys who cooked it they looked super nice i felt sorry that they had to work in such a shitty really sad after that I understand why the place was dead "Thi place is sucks plain and simple.This place is so lame, don't know why it has four stars, terrible service I WILL NOT BE COMING BACK.If I could leave negative 2 stars I would


Este es definitivamente el peor lugar en el que hemos estado. Viajábamos a Las Vegas desde Nueva York, el lugar era asqueroso y la señora que toma nuestro pedido no nos hiso  sentir bienvenidos fue realmente terrible . También la mujer que parecía que ella trabajaba en la parte de atrás nos da la mirada más desagradable que alguna vez me han dado. las únicas personas que me hicieron sentir seguro de que mi plato no lo Ivan a escupir  fueron los muchachos que lo cocinaron, se veían súper nice sentí lástima de que tuvieran que trabajar en un lugar tan mierda ,  triste después de eso, entiendo por qué el lugar estaba muerto ". es una mierda simple y llana. Este lugar es muy cojo, no sé por qué tiene cuatro estrellas, un servicio terrible. NO VOLVERÉ. Si pudiera dejar 2 estrellas negativas, lo haría.

Pizza was delicious, doesn't quite taste like the ones they make in Cuba but that's nearly impossible to do.  

Service was also satisfying!

Who would've thought you get great pizza at a Cuban bakery in the middle of Vegas? Absolutely fantastic pizza, nice depth of the dough, good sauce and cheese combination, it bakes just perfectly. You can tell the owner is a true artisan at what he creates. I'd definitely return here every time I get back to Sun City.
Excelentes espaguetis y los batidos riquísimos. Recomiendo este lugar a todo aquel que desee recordar el sabor de los espaguetis y pizzas cubanas
El lugar es pequeño pero limpio. Batido d guayaba, mango y mamey los tres riquísimos. La pizza estaba buena.

Small little hole in the wall. The service is a little slow, and the food is a little greasy. But overall, the food is pretty authentic tasting. Tastes like what your mom would make at home. It's not the most exceptional Cuban food I've had, but for a quick bite, hits the spot.
It's a great place to get a small bite. Inexpensive the guava pastry are delicious fresh and flaky.

La pizza que hacen les queda buena pero empalagan, hoy fui por un brazo gitano y unos dulces en amivar, el brazo gitano estaba seco, no tenia nada de crema. Los dulces tenian 2 pelos adentro de la cajita. Cuando vi el primero dije, esta bien a todos se nos cae el pelo, ya con el segundo casi me vomito. 

Never again, vengo aqui.
Sin duda las mejores pizza en Las Vegas! El sabor de su comida es delicioso y el lugar esta increíble! Excelente su servicio! Sin duda regreso siempre!
Great little Cubano restaurant, portions are large and prices are small.  It helps if you speak Español, because they do not speak English.

Saw this place browsing here on Yelp and decided to try the pizza. Stopped by on my way home from work to pick up lunch. Small place with a mom and pop feel. Went with a personal 'chiquita' Hawaiian pizza. They make it fresh so took about 15 minutes for it to be ready. It was definitely worth the wait. Dough was thick and chewy. Toppings of ham and pineapple were plentiful and not lacking like a lot of chain pizzas. After demolishing the pie, I was wondering if they had any sauce on the pizza. Maybe that's Cuban style without sauce? Anyway, with or without sauce it was very good. Will definitely be back and try their pepperoni sometime.

You have to try your self is very good and they use good quality products, the one i order was the $6 is like a Med size whith plenty chesee and Spanish imported Chorizo in thick Crust, definitive i will go back and try the Peperoni or the Garlic one, before i finich i have to said this place looks very clean

This is a small restaurant that specializes in Cuban style pizza. Cuban pizza is not much different than a Classic Italian with the difference coming by way of the dough used and ingredients.  They offer an assortment of toppings. They also have pastries and drinks. 

Today I stopped by for a coffee and pastry. Cuban coffee is really potent and has a particular taste that I love.  I ordered a cafe con leche and pastry. Coffee was good. Service was pleasant. Interior space is basic.  I didn't have a pie because I already had lunch but will have to come back soon.

I came to place an order for a birthday cake. The open sign was on, so I proceed to open the door. The few people that were inside started making some gestures i didn't understand. Then a man came closer, and with very rude gestures pointed a some small later that said: closed on Wednesday. 
It would only take him a second to open the door, and say: we are close today. I apologize for the inconvenience. 
I simply drove two blocks down, and went to Roly's bakery, where they happily helped me. 
There are many restaurants in town that make great cuban food. If you don't provide good customer service, you are out of the game. Learn the business.
Pizzas are exquisite! Authentic Cuban flavor! Batidos(milkshakes) are creamy and made with real fruit! Must go place! The owner is very friendly!

Today is the last day I EVER order pizza or anything from this place! The bitch at the counter can't even get an order over the phone without fucking it all up! 

I have ordered 8 times over the phone, and when I arrive I am told my order isn't ready. And when I inquire they are always on top of the oven rack, and when I get home my order is always wrong. 

Today I ordered a CHORIZO pizza and got a fucking pepperoni! And the worst thing is having some stupid ass bitch trying to argue with a customer!

I don't know how or why she is still at the counter with her fucked up attitude when she can't take a simple fucking order, the cooks dick must be so far up her ass, that she can't control a pen! 

Fuck this place!!!

To bad this cunt ruined the reputation of the restaurant, I really did enjoy the food, but I'll take my money elsewhere..

Sayonara suckers!!!!


Pic #1: chorizo pizza
Pic #2: Pepperoni
Yes a little bit heartbroken we went today and the place is closed yeah closed until further notice I guess the fixing up the place

My Barber is Cuban and said this place had bomb pizza.  It sits way in the back so a little hard to find.  I didn't know their was such a thing as Cuban pizza.  Fantastic flavor and a buttery crust that was killer.  Very interesting toppings especially liked a topping that looks like smoked bacon fat.  I also had a Cuban Sandwich and it too was excellent.  Yum go try it.  Great service.

Well I am always a fan of Cuban Restaurants. I am always looking for the perfect Cuban Sandwich. Not being Cuban I have needed help to find Cuban Cuban Sandwiches. This involves listening to others, while developing a taste, and tasting what is presented. So here is a Cuban Cuban Sandwich, made by Cubans. Oh Yeah! Not an Americanized Cuban Sandwich, but a Cuban Sandwich. excellent Sandwich, and superb fries.
Order in Spanish, it helps. The restaurant is not fancy. It is very very clean. and I can hardly wait to come back and try the Cuban pizza choices as well.
Thank You Cuban Sylvain Bakery
